skill.name: summary-generator
skill.description: This skill should be used when generating lesson summaries for educational content. It extracts key concepts, mental models, patterns, and common mistakes from lesson markdown files using a Socratic extraction process. Use this skill when a lesson file needs a `.summary.md` companion file, or when reviewing/refreshing existing summaries.

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only documentation and prompt instructions. No executable code, network calls, file system access, or environment variable reading. Pure prompt-based skill with zero risk factors.

content.user_title: Generate lesson summaries with Socratic extraction
content.value_statement: Creating lesson summaries manually takes time and risks missing key insights. This skill uses a proven Socratic questioning framework to consistently extract core concepts, mental models, and practical patterns from any lesson file.
actual_capabilities: Extract single core concept from any lesson using targeted questioning
Identify 2-3 reusable mental models and thinking frameworks
Map 2-4 actionable patterns and techniques from lesson content
Document 2-3 common mistakes students make with corrections
Build connection maps showing prerequisite and follow-up topics
limitations: Only generates summaries for markdown lesson files
Requires the AI to read lesson content first before summarizing
Does not modify or edit existing summaries automatically
No support for non-educational content types

use_cases.title: Create companion summaries
use_cases.description: Generate .summary.md files for new lessons to provide quick reference guides for students.

use_cases.title: Audit existing summaries
use_cases.description: Review and refresh outdated lesson summaries using the Socratic framework for quality.

use_cases.title: Extract key takeaways
use_cases.description: Pull essential concepts and patterns from lessons to share in study guides or quick references.

prompt_templates.title: Basic summary request
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the summary-generator skill to create a .summary.md file for this lesson. Read the lesson first, then apply the Socratic extraction process.

prompt_templates.title: Review existing summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Use summary-generator to review this lesson and identify if any key concepts, mental models, or patterns are missing from the current summary.

prompt_templates.title: Level-based summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a summary for this A2/B1/C1 level lesson using the summary-generator skill. Target the word count appropriate for the proficiency level.

prompt_templates.title: Quick extraction
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the Socratic questions from summary-generator: What is the one thing students must remember? What mental models does this install? What patterns can they apply? What mistakes do they make?

output_examples.input: Generate a summary for a Python functions lesson
output: Core Concept: Functions are reusable blocks of code that perform specific tasks and can accept inputs and return outputs.
Key Mental Models: Input ‚Üí Process ‚Üí Output flow; DRY principle (Do Not Repeat Yourself); Function as contract between caller and implementation.
Critical Patterns: Define with def keyword; parameters for inputs; return statement for outputs; default argument values.
Common Mistakes: Forgetting to call the function; confusing print with return; not handling None returns.
Connections: Builds on: Variables and data types; Leads to: Classes and object-oriented programming.

best_practices: Always read the full lesson file before applying the Socratic extraction questions
Validate each summary against the anti-patterns checklist before finalizing
Match summary length to the proficiency level specified in lesson frontmatter
anti_patterns: Including full explanations instead of pointing to concepts
Copying code examples instead of describing patterns
Using framework terminology that students should not see

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: Only markdown lesson files with frontmatter. The skill reads content and outputs .summary.md files.

faq.question: What proficiency levels can it handle?
faq.answer: All levels from A1-A2 (beginner) through C1-C2 (advanced) with appropriate word count targets.

faq.question: Does it work with nested lesson structures?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill reads any markdown file and generates summaries regardless of directory structure.

faq.question: Is lesson content stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. The AI processes lesson content in context only during the summary generation session.

faq.question: What if the summary misses important concepts?
faq.answer: Run the skill again or use the Socratic questions directly to identify gaps in the generated summary.

faq.question: How is this different from generic summarization tools?
faq.answer: Uses pedagogical Socratic questioning designed specifically for educational content with mental models and patterns.
